Posts.Content: Thanks debs for the info, will try to get femara from my GP. Callierose x
Posts.Title: Aching joints

Posts.Content: Hi hi I am four weeks post radiotherapy and have joint pains, I loosen up with e forty five cream then try gentle excersise some days I can't manage any. I just have to try on the days I am up to it. I was letrozole can't rember which brand but felt awful I change to accord brand and felt better off this but we are having trouble finding a chemist that supplies it I presume it's the cost.Â
Posts.Title: Aching joints

Posts.Content: Hi pipplewick, new to Internet and the site don't even know what I am doing lol. I was on litrozole for a month after surgery I to felt awful so change to accord my pharmacy said it could have been something simple as the colouring in the tablet. I have felt better off the accord but getting hot flushes and my joints ache. On second week of radiotherapy, I'm starting to feel weary it consumes your life for the three weeks of treatment. X
